Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk openscap
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: openscap bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The OpenSCAP suite enables integration of the Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP) line of standards. The openscap packages provide the OpenSCAP library and the oscap utility that provides various SCAP capabilities. The openscap packages have been upgraded to upstream version 1.2.9, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. Most notably, this update adds support for scanning containers using the "atomic scan" command. In addition, this update includes the following enhancements: the oscap-vm utility for offline scanning of virtual machines the oscap-chroot utility for offline scanning of file systems mounted at arbitrary paths full support for the Open Vulnerability and Assessment Language (OVAL) security language, version OVAL 5.11.1 native support for remote.xml.bz2 files grouping results in HTML reports according to various criteria HTML report improvements verbose mode for debugging OVAL evaluation (BZ#1333812) Users of openscap are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and adds these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
